tests.explanation: Both programs output the same number of zeros in the input array, as the mutation only changes the condition inside the if statement to check if the value is truthy instead of equal to zero.
The original program correctly counts 2 zeros in the input array, while the mutated program counts all non-zero elements as zeroes, resulting in an incorrect count of 5 zeros.
Both programs output the same number of zeros in the input array, as there are no non-zero elements in the array to trigger the mutated condition.
